snippet: Sotheby’s is to auction about 400 images from Henry Buhl’s collection of photographs of hands; Zwirner to open new galleries in Chelsea and London; The Indianapolis Museum of Art has commissioned art for the public spaces of the Alexander Hotel.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Sotheby’s will auction about 400 images from Henry Buhl’s collection of photographs of hands; David Zwirner plans to open a second New York City gallery as well as one in London; The Indianapolis Museum of Art has commissioned art for the public spaces of the Alexander, a hotel being built by Buckingham Companies in downtown Indianapolis.
lead_paragraph: Sotheby’s is to auction about 400 images from Henry Buhl’s collection of photographs of hands; Zwirner to open new galleries in Chelsea and London; The Indianapolis Museum of Art has commissioned art for the public spaces of the Alexander Hotel.

headline.seo: Henry Buhl’s Collection of Hands Photographs at Sotheby’s
headline.main: A Collection of Many Hands to Be Sold in Sotheby’s Auction
headline.print_headline: A Collection of Many Hands To Be Sold in Sotheby’s Auction
